title: Weird `type annotations needed` error caused by irrelevant code
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
fn main() {
    // Delete the following line to get rid of the error
    let a: String = serde_yaml::from_str("").unwrap();

    if 1_u16 == 2_u8 as _ { // Error: type annotations needed (E0282)
        println!("???");
    }
}
```
```toml
[package]
name = "bug_test"
authors = ["x"]
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021"

[dependencies]
# At least using version 0.9.2 eliminates the error
serde_yaml = "0.8.26"
```

I expected to see this happen: Compiled successfully

Instead, this happened:
```
error[E0282]: type annotations needed
 --> src/main.rs:5:25
  |
5 |     if 1_u16 == 2_u8 as _ { // Error: type annotations needed (E0282)
  |                         ^ cannot infer type
```
Deleting the first line of the code eliminates the error but I can't see how they are related. I suspect that this is a compiler bug.
